intro: Pimpinella tibetanica, commonly known as the Tibetan茴香, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. It is known for its aromatic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Pimpinella tibetanica is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
